activities.loc: Grant County Courthouse - Br. I - 3rd Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Alvin Harvey

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice - Attorney Fees; cc: defendant 10/21/22 SH

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Alvin Harvey in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Prior to court, defendant was provided with waiver of attorney and plea questionnaire forms. State has not made an offer. Court reviews advantages of having counsel. Defendant requests court appointed counsel. Defendant to complete petition and court will appoint. Defendant to repay $200 per month beginning October 15, 2022. Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Alvin Harvey appeared by phone, unapproved.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Defendant wants to plea no contest to charge. Court heard, defendant will need to appear in person to enter his plea, and to fill out waiver of attorney paperwork. Court sets plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael Alvin Harvey appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant says he does not qualify for SPD and says Attorney Stroud is his attorney. State requests a $1000 signature bond. Court orders $1000 signature bond. Court sets arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
